ReportSection.name: General Instructions
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Review Form and Instructions

All applications will be reviewed by the HQP Advisory Committee based on the following criteria:

  1. Scholarly Merit & Quality of Proposed Research (40%)
    • Statement of research focus
    • Research objectives/aims
    • How will you achieve your project goals?
  2. Fit with AGE-WELL Goals and Priorities (40%)
    • Biography and career goals
    • Alignment to the mission and goals of AGE-WELL
    • Potential for commercialization and/or knowledge mobilization
    • Potential for innovation
  3. Quality of training environment (20%)
    • Industry and/or community partners
    • In what ways will your project go beyond conventional disciplinary boundaries?
    • Training context
    • Other funding obtained/applied for?

Prior to undertaking the reviews, please familiarize yourself with the AGE-WELL Graduate Student and Postdoctoral Awards in Technology and Aging Information Package and the AGE-WELL Network Goals document that were provided to applicants.

To make the review process as simple as possible, provide a single overall score for each criterion using the following scale:

Please use the following scale to provide an overall assessment on each of the three criteria

Potential ImpactImpact ScoreDescriptorAdditional Guidance on Strengths/Weaknesses
High9ExceptionalExceptionally strong with essentially no weaknesses
8OutstandingExtremely strong with negligible weaknesses
7ExcellentVery strong with only some minor weaknesses
Moderate6Very GoodStrong but with numerous minor weaknesses
5GoodStrong but with at least one moderate weakness
4SatisfactorySome strengths but also some moderate weaknesses
Low3FairSome strengths but with at least one major weakness
2MarginalA few strengths and a few major weaknesses
1PoorVery few strengths and numerous major weaknesses
Definitions
Minor: weakness that does not substantially lessen the quality of the proposal or potential of the candidate.
Moderate: weakness that lessens the quality of the proposal or potential of the candidate
Major: weakness that severely limits the quality of the proposal or potential of the candidate

Please use the comment boxes to justify your score. We have provided some questions to guide scoring on each criterion. Please bear these in mind, but use your own judgment if you think other factors are relevant.

There is also an overall comments box where you can highlight the key attributes of the applicant. Please note that in these HQP awards we are particularly trying to identify candidates with strong potential to go on to be part of AGE-WELL’s “New Generation” of researchers, e.g.

  • Vision for their research that goes beyond traditional disciplines and silos
  • New ideas and approaches to old problems
  • Willingness to learn new skills
  • Awareness of the importance of commercial and social impact
  • Strong identification with AGE-WELL vision
  • Potential contribution to HQP community

Emphasis here should be on potential rather than the technicalities of the research proposal itself. For example, the candidate may not have well worked out plans for knowledge mobilization or commercialization, but demonstrates a keen willingness to learn and adapt. We should also be thinking about the value that this student will gain from being part of AGE-WELL training environment, rather than a traditional one and where a more traditional scholarship is appropriate.

A key aspect of AGE-WELL’s training philosophy is that we have the ability to fund HQP who may not be funded through traditional funding sources (e.g. CIHR, NSERC, SSHRC). We are looking to fund individuals who are thinking “outside of the box”, and who are interested in pursuing non-traditional roles within their training program. For example we will strongly consider and encourage applicants focusing on developing new products and start-up companies, or someone who is not interested in pursuing a traditional academic position but would rather work in industry, governmental, or other community-based positions.

ReportItemSet.ReportItem:
1. Overall comments

  • What are key strengths of the proposal/applicant?
  • What are the weaknesses?
  • Is this applicant representative of AGE-WELL’s vision for a new type of HQP?
  • Any other comments?
 {$item}

2. Scholarly Merit & Quality of Proposed Research (40%)

  • Does the applicant have novel ideas and approaches to the problem space?
  • Does the research address AGE-WELL key research questions and/or CC themes?
  • Are objectives clearly defined?
  • Is the proposed research likely to achieve the stated objectives of the project?
  • Does the proposal identify research, timeline and deliverables?
  • Does the proposal outline both academic and “non-academic” activities e.g. knowledge mobilization?
  • Is the research plan well thought-through and clearly stated?
 Overall Score: {$item}

3. Fit with AGE-WELL Goals and Priorities (40%)

  • Does the applicant have strong career goals?
  • Does the proposed research outline a strategy for achieving real-world impact?
  • To what extent is the proposed research aligned with AGE-WELL network goals?
  • What is the potential for commercialization and/or knowledge mobilization?
  • What is the potential for innovation?
 Overall Score: {$item}

4. Quality of training environment (20%)

  • Does the applicant have good links with industry and/or community partners?
  • Are project goals aligned with partner goals and priorities?
  • Are there strong plans for networking/links to other projects?
  • To what extent does the project go beyond the HQP’s typical disciplinary boundaries?
  • Is there a good research environment – e.g. supervisor and departmental resources and support?
  • Is the project part of a bigger program of research?
  • Does the student have other sources of financial support?
 Overall Score: {$item}
